claims.title: Negligent Non-Compliance with NJFCRA - Inaccurate Reporting
claims.description: The CRA negligently failed to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information in a consumer's credit report, leading to inaccurate reporting.
elements: The CRA reported inaccurate information about the plaintiff.
The CRA failed to follow reasonable procedures to ensure accuracy.
The plaintiff suffered actual damages as a result of the inaccurate reporting.
The CRA's actions were negligent.

claims.title: Willful Non-Compliance with NJFCRA - Inaccurate Reporting
claims.description: The CRA willfully, or with knowing or reckless disregard for the law, failed to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of information in a consumer's report.
elements: The CRA reported inaccurate information about the plaintiff.
The CRA's failure to follow reasonable procedures was willful.
The plaintiff suffered damages (actual, statutory, and potentially punitive).

claims.title: Negligent Failure to Reinvestigate Disputed Information
claims.description: After a consumer disputed the accuracy of information, the CRA negligently failed to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to verify the information's accuracy.
elements: The plaintiff notified the CRA of a dispute regarding information in their file.
The CRA's reinvestigation was unreasonable or not conducted at all.
The failure was negligent.
The plaintiff suffered actual damages from the continued inaccuracy.

claims.title: Willful Failure to Reinvestigate Disputed Information
claims.description: After a consumer dispute, the CRA willfully failed to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation, showing a knowing or reckless disregard for its statutory duties.
elements: The plaintiff disputed information with the CRA.
The CRA's failure to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation was willful.
The plaintiff suffered damages (actual, statutory, and potentially punitive).

claims.title: Failure to Provide Written Notice of Reinvestigation Results
claims.description: The CRA failed to provide the consumer with written notice of the results of its reinvestigation within five business days of its completion.
elements: The CRA completed a reinvestigation of the consumer's dispute.
The CRA failed to provide written notice of the results within five business days.
The failure resulted in damages to the plaintiff.

causes_of_action.category: Claims Against Furnishers of Information (e.g., Banks)

claims.title: Negligent Failure to Conduct an Investigation (Furnisher)
claims.description: After receiving notice of a dispute from a CRA, the furnisher of information negligently failed to conduct its own reasonable investigation into the disputed information as required by the NJFCRA.
elements: The consumer disputed information with a CRA.
The CRA notified the furnisher of the dispute.
The furnisher failed to conduct a reasonable and timely investigation.
The furnisher's failure was negligent.
The plaintiff suffered actual damages.

claims.title: Willful Failure to Conduct an Investigation (Furnisher)
claims.description: After receiving notice of a dispute from a CRA, the furnisher willfully failed to conduct a reasonable investigation, demonstrating a knowing or reckless disregard for its obligations.
elements: The consumer disputed information with a CRA.
The CRA notified the furnisher of the dispute.
The furnisher's failure to investigate was willful.
The plaintiff suffered damages (actual, statutory, and potentially punitive).

legal_violations.statute: New Jersey Fair Credit Reporting Act (NJFCRA)

violations.title: Accuracy of Information
violations.description: Requires a credit reporting agency to 'maintain reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy' of the information in a consumer report.

violations.title: Reinvestigation of Disputed Information
violations.description: Mandates that a CRA reinvestigate disputed items of information, usually within 30 days, and record the current status or delete the item if it's found to be inaccurate, unverifiable, or untimely.

violations.title: Failure to Provide Reinvestigation Results
violations.description: A CRA must provide the consumer with written notice of the results of a reinvestigation not later than five business days after the completion of the reinvestigation.

violations.title: Failure to Provide Statement of Dispute
violations.description: Requires the CRA to include a statement of the dispute in subsequent consumer reports if the reinvestigation does not resolve the dispute.

violations.title: Furnisher's Duty to Investigate Disputed Information
violations.description: After being notified of a dispute by a CRA, a furnisher must conduct an investigation, review all relevant information, and report the results to the CRA.

violations.title: Furnisher's Duty to Report Accurate Information
violations.description: Prohibits a person from furnishing information relating to a consumer to any CRA if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

violations.title: Civil Liability for Noncompliance
violations.description: Establishes civil liability for negligent and willful noncompliance with the NJFCRA, allowing for recovery of actual damages, punitive damages (for willful violations), costs, and reasonable attorney's fees.
